Understate: The claim may understate the limitations on enrichment under the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty by stating that it has been limited to basically the weapons states.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the statement that enrichment has been limited to basically the weapons states.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that allowing Iran to continue with enrichment is breaking one of the key requirements of the nonproliferation treaty, which may be a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations or interpretations of the nonproliferation treaty and its limitations on enrichment, which are not addressed in the claim.
